sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>roof</radical> (hive) on a <radical>certain</radical> <radical>insect</radical> (a bee) is what protects all of the <kanji>honey</kanji> or <kanji>nectar</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Bees are a certain insect that build a roof around their honey.
readingMnemonic: To get the <kanji>honey</kanji> out, you need to put on special <reading>mitts</reading> (<ja>みつ</ja>) so your hands don't get stung.
readingInfo: Your thick mitts make it so the bees can't even sting your hands. Unfortunately, you are naked and only wearing mitts, what were you thinking?
